title: Credit Suisse Reports $2.2 Billion Loss From Charges, Lower Revenue
sub_head: The Swiss bank, reeling from major stumbles, says 2022 will be a year of transition
body:
Credit Suisse Group AG reported a worse-than-expected fourth-quarter loss from fallen revenue and said 2022 will be a year of transition after punishing hits to its balance sheet and reputation.
The bank posted a net loss of 2 billion Swiss francs, equivalent to $2.16 billion, for the three months ending December. It had warned profits would be hit by legal costs and other charges. Net revenue for the quarter fell 12% year on year.
